<p>You saw the preview photo last week and now <strong>RoverDude</strong> is back with <a href="http://bit.ly/1wQQdd1"><strong>REGOLITH</strong></a>, an open and extensible ISRU and resource framework. It’s but the first of two phases that will build a framework for handling resource harvesting. There are parts here, but this is not a parts pack. It’s a work in progress and an early look at a lofty mod that holds a lot of promise.</p>

<p>Find the full list of features and a download <a href="http://bit.ly/1wQQdd1"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>

Don't get me wrong, RoverDude makes some great stuff. But this isn't even a remotely finished mod. Why didn't they pick one of his others? Well, Squad is planning to develop some sort of resources mechanic during the beta phase...

I think it's a great thing that they're acknowledging Regolith's existance right away, because from the looks of it, Regolith is doing a lot of things right. At minimum it's a useful showcase of what the community would love to see out of a versatile resource framework, and that'll be of help to the devs when they get to drafting up their own variant. Showing interest in what the community thinks and does really drives home the point that the game is "for the players", and that makes me happy.

Of course, recently a handful of mods found their way into the stock game, and who knows, maybe when the time comes, Regolith has a chance... but always keep in mind that that isn't something Squad is required to do, just because they happened to do it two updates in a row.

I don't mean to sound rude here, but exactly what is the difference between this and karbonite or kethane?

Karbonite, made by RoverDude the maker of Regolith, runs on the Open Resource System (ORS) and ORSX (Those are basically the right abbreviations). After making a few resource based mods (ART, Karbonite, and OKS I believe), and Karbonite+, he decided he wanted a new resource system. Regolith is the framework of the system. You can go to the dev thread to see more details and more accurate explanations.

Karbonite, made by RoverDude the maker of Regolith, runs on the Open Resource System (ORS) and ORSX (Those are basically the right abbreviations). After making a few resource based mods (ART, Karbonite, and OKS I believe), and Karbonite+, he decided he wanted a new resource system. Regolith is the framework of the system. You can go to the dev thread to see more details and more accurate explanations.

(Edit misread - but for clarity, Karbonite no longer runs on ORS, it runs on a fork (ORSX))

Karbonite and Kethane are both resource mods. Regolith is a resource framework. The closest analogue would be ORS. I *used* to use ORS. Then I extended it. Then I forked it. Then I outgreq it. Hence, Regolith, which I will be moving all of my mods to.

So you have: Kethane (used by kethane and extraplanetary launchpads, though there are adaptions for EL for other systems), ORS (used by KSPI), and ORSX (Soon to be Regolith) used by Karbonite, MKS/OKS, etc.

Neither Kethane nor ORS work when your ship is not focused (ORSX has this, and I moved this to Regolith as well).

Neither Kethane, ORS, or ORSX handled asteroids (this is new in Regolith).

ORS has no generic converter code outside of resource harvesting. I belive Kethane has one, but has the same unattended processing limitation noted above. Regolith adds this.

That's the short version of it, though there is more in the actual forun post
